title: How to Draw a Human Head

steps.headline: Start by drawing three oval shapes, one large one and 2 smaller ones on the left and right side of the large oval.
steps.description: Add also thin guidelines such as a vertical line and two horizontal lines to serve as a guide in drawing the eyes and mouth of the model.

steps.headline: Use the first guideline to draw the eyes.
steps.description: In drawing the eyes draw a pointy oblong shape with four circles in it, add also some wavy eyelashes since for this picture the model used is a young woman.

steps.headline: Add a pair sculpted eyebrows and some lines to illustrate the eyelid.
Make the nose.
steps.description: Then in the middle of the face and along the vertical guideline draw now his/ her nose. In drawing the nose, remember to make the lines broken to achieve an effect.

steps.headline: Draw the lips on the second horizontal guideline.
Finally draw the hair and a squiggly line on the left ear and you’re done drawing the face.
Outline your drawing with a black pen or marker and then apply an amount of shading on your drawing using a charcoal pencil or a regular pencil.
steps.description: And then apply a minimal amount of color by coloring the lips and eyes.

steps.headline: Draw a profile of a human head.
steps.description: Start this step by drawing a bald human head and by drawing the contours of the model’s nose and lips. Add also an oblong shape for the ear.

steps.headline: Draw the eyes of the model, however draw only one eye and one eyebrow.
steps.description: Draw the eye by drawing first a triangular shape.

steps.headline: Make the nose and mouth of the model.
steps.description: Draw the lips of the model by copying the shape of a heart positioned horizontally.

steps.headline: Add the details of one ear by drawing squiggly lines.
End drawing by sketching her hair in a bun if you like.
Ink and color your drawing and you’re done with the second drawing!
steps.description: Outline your drawing with a black pen or marker; add some pencil shading and then apply a minimal amount of color.

text: Forward Facing Head Start by drawing three oval shapes, one large one and 2 smaller ones on the left and right side of the large oval. Add also thin guidelines such as a vertical line and two horizontal lines to serve as a guide in drawing the eyes and mouth of the model. Use the first guideline to draw the eyes. In drawing the eyes draw a pointy oblong shape with four circles in it, add also some wavy eyelashes since for this picture the model used is a young woman. Add a pair sculpted eyebrows and some lines to illustrate the eyelid.  Make the nose. Then in the middle of the face and along the vertical guideline draw now his/ her nose. In drawing the nose, remember to make the lines broken to achieve an effect. Draw the lips on the second horizontal guideline.  Finally draw the hair and a squiggly line on the left ear and you’re done drawing the face.  Outline your drawing with a black pen or marker and then apply an amount of shading on your drawing using a charcoal pencil or a regular pencil. And then apply a minimal amount of color by coloring the lips and eyes. Profile Human Head Draw a profile of a human head. Start this step by drawing a bald human head and by drawing the contours of the model’s nose and lips. Add also an oblong shape for the ear. Draw the eyes of the model, however draw only one eye and one eyebrow. Draw the eye by drawing first a triangular shape. Make the nose and mouth of the model. Draw the lips of the model by copying the shape of a heart positioned horizontally. Add the details of one ear by drawing squiggly lines.  End drawing by sketching her hair in a bun if you like.  Ink and color your drawing and you’re done with the second drawing! Outline your drawing with a black pen or marker; add some pencil shading and then apply a minimal amount of color.
sentences: Forward Facing Head Start by drawing three oval shapes, one large one and 2 smaller ones on the left and right side of the large oval.
Add also thin guidelines such as a vertical line and two horizontal lines to serve as a guide in drawing the eyes and mouth of the model.
Use the first guideline to draw the eyes.
In drawing the eyes draw a pointy oblong shape with four circles in it, add also some wavy eyelashes since for this picture the model used is a young woman.
Add a pair sculpted eyebrows and some lines to illustrate the eyelid.
Make the nose.
Then in the middle of the face and along the vertical guideline draw now his/ her nose.
In drawing the nose, remember to make the lines broken to achieve an effect.
Draw the lips on the second horizontal guideline.
Finally draw the hair and a squiggly line on the left ear and you’re done drawing the face.
Outline your drawing with a black pen or marker and then apply an amount of shading on your drawing using a charcoal pencil or a regular pencil.
And then apply a minimal amount of color by coloring the lips and eyes.
Profile Human Head Draw a profile of a human head.
Start this step by drawing a bald human head and by drawing the contours of the model’s nose and lips.
Add also an oblong shape for the ear.
Draw the eyes of the model, however draw only one eye and one eyebrow.
Draw the eye by drawing first a triangular shape.
Make the nose and mouth of the model.
Draw the lips of the model by copying the shape of a heart positioned horizontally.
Add the details of one ear by drawing squiggly lines.
End drawing by sketching her hair in a bun if you like.
Ink and color your drawing and you’re done with the second drawing!
Outline your drawing with a black pen or marker; add some pencil shading and then apply a minimal amount of color.
tyn_section: A blank piece of good drawing paper
A pencil, these will vary from the usual #2 to a variety of special artists pencils
A photo of who you want to draw (or you can freestyle)
